subject: Leadership
title: Ego and Leadership
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Ego and Leadership.

hook.text: A CEO won't admit a strategy is failing. His identity is tied to the plan. Ego overrides evidence. The company suffers.

buildup.text: Ego is the part of identity that protects self-image. It helps in small doses but distorts reality when unchecked.

discovery.text: Ryan Holiday: ego turns confidence into arrogance, learning into lecturing, and success into entitlement. It's subtle.

twist.text: Ego is loudest after success. The bigger the win, the harder it is to stay curious, humble, and open to new information.

climax.text: Check ego with practices: journaling, mentorship, and a question: 'Am I defending my idea or the best idea?'

punchline.text: Ego is the enemy of the leader you could become.

quiz.question: When is ego most dangerous for leaders?
